extendedIngredients.name: canned crabmeat
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (6 ounces) crabmeat, drained, flaked and cartilage removed

recipes.title: Crab-Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Tiamo Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Cut a thin slice off the top of each tomato. Scoop out pulp, leaving a 1/2-in. shell. Invert onto paper towels to drain. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.                                                                                            Stuff tomatoes; place in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 8-10 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.                                        Yield: about 1-1/2 dozen.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Crab-Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes in  Country Woman ChristmasAnnual 1997, p20                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (3 each) equals 53 calories, 1 g fat (trace saturated fat), 25 mg cholesterol, 136 mg sodium, 5 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 7 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Cut a thin slice off the top of each tomato. Scoop out pulp, leaving a 1/2-in. shell. Invert onto paper towels to drain. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.
Stuff tomatoes; place in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 8-10 minutes or until heated through.
